warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles, gradually increasing the size. Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds each direction.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Alternate between arching your back (cow) and rounding it (cat). Perform 2 sets of 10 reps.
Reach one arm overhead and lean to the opposite side, alternating sides. Perform 2 sets of 10 reps per side.

exercises.setup: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
execution: 1. Grip the bar with a wide grip, palms facing forward.
2. Sit down with your back straight and feet flat on the floor.
3. Pull the bar down towards your upper chest, keeping your elbows pointed down and back.
4. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
5. Slowly return the bar to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 10-12 reps with good form, typically around 60-75% of your 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit at a lat pull-down machine with a neutral grip attachment.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Grip the handles with palms facing each other.
2. Pull the handles down towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom.
4. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to perform 10-12 reps with proper form, similar to the main exercise.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on engaging your lats throughout the movement and avoid using momentum to pull the bar down.

exercises.exercise_name: Half Kneeling One Arm Lat Pull Down
exercises.setup: Kneel on one knee and brace against a bench or your knee for stability.
execution: 1. Grip the cable handle with one hand.
2. Pull the cable down by driving your elbow down and back.
3. Focus on squeezing your lat at the bottom of the movement.
4. Slowly return to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.weight: Use a weight that allows you to perform 10-12 reps per arm with good form, focusing on the stretch and contraction.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit at a cable row machine with feet braced against the footplate.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Grip the handle with both hands.
2. Pull the handle towards your torso, keeping your elbows close to your body.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the end of the movement.
4. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with proper form, focusing on the back muscles.
exercises.additional_tips: Ensure your core is engaged to maintain stability and prevent twisting during the movement.

exercises.setup: Use a chest-supported row machine or incline bench.
execution: 1. Lie face down on the bench with your chest supported.
2. Grip the handles or dumbbells with palms facing each other.
3. Pull the weight towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
4. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to perform 10-12 reps with good form, focusing on the contraction of the back muscles.
exercises.alternative_equipments: Dumbbell row on an incline bench
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Stand beside a barbell loaded on one end, with the other end secured.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Bend at the hips and knees, gripping the barbell with one hand.
2. Pull the barbell towards your hip, keeping your elbow close to your body.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blade at the top of the movement.
4. Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with proper form, focusing on the back muscles.
exercises.additional_tips: Keep your chest firmly against the pad to isolate the back muscles and prevent using momentum.
